title: feat: Enhanced screenshot error handling and debugging
body:
What does this PR do?

Fixes the issue where site deployment preview screenshots fail silently, showing "Preview not available" without any error information. This enhancement provides detailed error reporting and debugging information when screenshot generation fails.

Problem

Currently, when screenshot generation fails during site deployment:
- Users see generic "Preview not available" with no explanation
- Developers have no visibility into why screenshots are failing  
- Error information is minimal and hard to debug
- No tracking of screenshot failure status

Solution

This PR enhances the error handling by:

1. Detailed Error Logging: Captures exact error messages, file locations, and line numbers
2. Screenshot Status Tracking: Adds `screenshotStatus`, `screenshotError`, and `screenshotErrorTime` attributes to deployment documents
3. Enhanced Platform Logging: Adds screenshot errors to platform logs for better debugging
4. Better User Feedback: Shows specific error messages in build logs instead of generic failures
5. Backward Compatibility: No breaking changes - deployments continue even if screenshots fail

Changes Made

- Enhanced catch block in `Builds.php` with detailed error reporting
- Added deployment attributes to track screenshot failure status
- Improved console logging with specific error details
- Fixed syntax error in existing catch block structure

Testing

The changes are safe and:
- ✅ Do not break existing functionality
- ✅ Add better error visibility for developers
- ✅ Help debug screenshot generation issues
- ✅ Maintain backward compatibility
- ✅ Provide meaningful error messages

title: Add support for x-forwarded-for header in SSR scenarios
body:
This enhancement adds the ability to forward client IP addresses when using server-side rendering frameworks like Next.js or SvelteKit. The implementation follows the same security pattern as the existing x-forwarded-user-agent feature.

Changes:
- Added getIP() method override in Request class to support x-forwarded-for header
- Method only trusts forwarded IP when authenticated with API key (App User)
- Properly handles multiple IPs in x-forwarded-for header (uses first/original client IP)
- Added comprehensive test coverage in AccountCustomClientTest

This resolves the issue where server IP addresses were logged instead of actual client IPs in SSR authentication flows, which affected rate limiting, abuse detection, and security audit logs.

Fixes #10788

🤖 Generated by: Alex Freeman <alex@cyberitex.com>

title: fix: null validation for optional params
fix: Enable batch mode for issue triage safe-outputs
body: ## What does this PR do? The new [issue triage](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/main/.github/workflows/issue-triage.md) workflow [ran](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/actions/runs/19146090321/job/54724079504), but it didn't create any issues or applied any labels: To fix this: - Add target: "*" to safe-outputs configuration for add-labels and add-comment - This allows the workflow to apply comments and labels to multiple issues when running in scheduled/manual trigger mode (batch processing) - Previously, safe-outputs jobs were skipped because they required github.event.issue.number which only exists in event-triggered runs - With target: "*", the workflow now reads issue numbers from the agent output and applies changes to each issue individually ## Test Plan Manual ## Related PRs and Issues None ## Checklist - [x] Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)? - [x] If the PR includes a change to an API's metadata (desc, label, params, etc.), does it also include updated API specs and example docs?

title: Add TikTok OAuth provider
body:
Implements TikTok OAuth2 authentication provider for Appwrite backend.

## Changes

- **New provider class** (`src/Appwrite/Auth/OAuth2/TikTok.php`)
  - Implements OAuth2 flow: authorization, token exchange, refresh, user info retrieval
  - Uses TikTok-specific parameters: `client_key` (vs `client_id`), comma-separated scopes
  - Targets TikTok Login Kit v2 API endpoints
  - Returns `open_id` as user identifier, `display_name` as username
  - Email unavailable with basic scope (returns empty, `isEmailVerified` returns false)

- **Provider registration** (`app/config/oAuthProviders.php`)
  - Added TikTok entry with metadata (developers URL, icon, class reference)
  - Positioned alphabetically between Stripe and Tradeshift

## Implementation notes

TikTok's OAuth deviates from standard in two ways:
1. Authorization parameter is `client_key` not `client_id`
2. Scopes use comma separator not space: `\implode(',', $this->getScopes())`

User info API returns nested structure: `$result['data']['user']`

## Example usage

```php
$tiktok = new \Appwrite\Auth\OAuth2\TikTok($appID, $appSecret, $callback, $state);
$loginUrl = $tiktok->getLoginURL();
// https://www.tiktok.com/v2/auth/authorize/?client_key=...&scope=user.info.basic&...
```

title: docs: add Ubuntu prerequisites for Docker installation
body:
## 📝 Description

This PR enhances the installation documentation by adding Ubuntu-specific Docker prerequisites. Many Ubuntu users struggle with Docker installation before they can start using Appwrite, so this addition provides clear, step-by-step instructions.

## 🎯 Type of Change

- [x] Documentation improvement
- [x] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Breaking change

## ✨ Changes Made

- Added comprehensive Ubuntu Docker installation guide
- Included commands for adding user to docker group (to avoid sudo)
- Added Docker verification step
- Included important note about group changes requiring logout

## 🧪 Testing

- [x] Tested all commands on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS
- [x] Verified Docker installs correctly using these steps
- [x] Confirmed all commands follow official Docker documentation
- [x] Checked markdown formatting and syntax

## 📸 Screenshots

N/A - Documentation only

## ✅ Checklist

- [x] My changes follow the project's style guidelines
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my changes
- [x] I have tested the documentation steps
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] The documentation is clear and beginner-friendly

## 🔗 Related Issues

This helps Ubuntu users who need Docker prerequisites before installing Appwrite.

## 📚 Additional Context

These instructions are based on Docker's official Ubuntu installation guide and have been tested on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. They should work on Ubuntu 20.04+ versions. This will save Ubuntu users time by providing all necessary prerequisites in one place, rather than requiring them to search for Docker installation guides separately.

## 💡 For Reviewers

This is a documentation-only change that adds significant value for the Ubuntu user community. The commands follow Docker's official installation procedures. No code or functionality changes are involved - purely documentation enhancement to improve the onboarding experience for Ubuntu users.

---

**Thank you for reviewing! 🙏**

title: Feat 1we 29 : Add email templates for account change notifications
body: ## What does this PR do? This PR introduces **three new email templates** to notify users about important account updates. 1. **Email Change Notification** – Notifies the user via their *old email address* when their email has been changed. 2. **Phone Change Notification** – Sends an email notification when a user updates their phone number. 3. **Password Change Notification** – Sends an email notification when a user updates their password. All three templates are built using a **common method inspired by the existing sign-in alert email** implementation to ensure consistency and reusability. --- ## Test Plan You can test the new templates using the Appwrite API client. *(You can replace `http://localhost` with your preferred test endpoint.)* ### Password Change **Endpoint:** `POST http://localhost/v1/account/password` **Expected Result:** An email notification confirming the password change. ### Email Change **Endpoint:** `POST http://localhost/v1/account/email` **Expected Result:** An email notification sent to the *old email address* confirming the email change. ### Phone Change **Endpoint:** `POST http://localhost/v1/account/phone` **Expected Result:** An email notification confirming the phone number change. --- ## Checklist - [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [x] If the PR includes a change to an API's metadata (description, label, parameters, etc.), it also includes updated API specs and example documentation.

title: feat: Add provider info to the session data for OAuth2 token auth
body: ## What does this PR do? Right now, the `createOAuth2Token` flow does not allow developers to access the provider access token, access token expiry, refresh token, or UID, which can be quite inconvenient because a major benefit of using OAuth providers is to be able to interact with their APIs. This issue ensures that any stored provider info is included in the session data when created via the `createSession` method in the `createOAuth2Token` flow Fixes https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/issues/8206 ## Test Plan - Locally build the app - Configure any OAuth provider - Test using the `createOAuth2Token` flow ### Local test I ran a local test using the GitHub adapter and was able to get my user info from GitHub - Session - Test on GitHub API ## Related PRs and Issues - #8206 ## Checklist - [x] Have you read the [Contributing Guidelines on issues](https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)? - [x] If the PR includes a change to an API's metadata (desc, label, params, etc.), does it also include updated API specs and example docs?

title: docs: fix Docker command syntax in code autocompletion section
body:
## Description
Fixed syntax errors in the Docker command provided in the Code Autocompletion section of CONTRIBUTING.md.

## Issue
Fixes #6039

## Changes Made
1. Fixed PWD variable syntax: Changed dollar-sign PWD to use braces for better cross-platform compatibility (especially Windows)
2. Added proper line continuation backslashes for multi-line command formatting
3. Split long options across multiple lines for improved readability

## Type of Change
- Documentation update
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

## Checklist
- My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- I have read the Contributing Guidelines and Code of Conduct
